description: build +â€Ž up, from the verb phrase.

entries.meaning: An accumulation; an increase; a gradual development.
examples: Snow buildup on roads makes for hazardous driving.
There was a buildup of pressure in the boiler.

entries.meaning: (dentistry) The construction of a composite core to repair a damaged tooth.
examples: Blocking undercuts out with bonded flowable composite is an option, but the time involved doing a buildup, plus the additional complication to provisionalize, make this option less desirable (Figure 6.19e).
